title: 108_s1703
content: The "Local Railroad Rehabilitation and Investment Act of 2003" may be cited as the Act. It introduces a credit for maintenance of railroad track under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Local Railroad Rehabilitation and Investment Act of 2003" introduces a credit for maintenance of railroad track under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit is based on qualified railroad track maintenance expenditures for Class II or Class III railroads, limited to $10,000 multiplied by the number of miles of track owned or leased by the taxpayer. The "Local Railroad Rehabilitation and Investment Act of 2003" introduces a credit for maintenance of railroad track under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit is based on qualified railroad track maintenance expenditures for Class II or Class III railroads, limited to $10,000 multiplied by the number of miles of track owned or leased by the taxpayer. The credit can be transferred and applies to expenditures incurred between 2003 and 2009. The "Local Railroad Rehabilitation and Investment Act of 2003" introduces a credit for maintenance of railroad track under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit can be transferred to an eligible taxpayer who transports property using the rail facilities of the taxpayer or provides railroad-related property or services. The transferor must receive compensation for the credit transfer equal to at least 50%. The "Local Railroad Rehabilitation and Investment Act of 2003" introduces a credit for maintenance of railroad track under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The credit transfer must compensate the transferor with at least 50% of the amount transferred. Any excess amount received by the transferee will be included in their gross income. Additionally, there is a limitation on carrying back the railroad track maintenance credit before January 1, 2004. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new railroad track maintenance credit under section 45G. This credit applies to railroad track maintenance and has specific provisions outlined in section 45G(e). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new railroad track maintenance credit under section 45G(e). A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The new railroad track maintenance credit under section 45G(e) applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2003.
